question: Question_04_(a)
statement:
Consider the function

\[F(x) = \begin{cases}
a & \text{if } x < 0, \\
k \arctan x & \text{if } 0 \leq x \leq 1, \\
b & \text{if } x \geq 1.
\end{cases}\]

\textbf{(a)} Find the values of \emph{a}, \emph{k} and \emph{b} for
which \emph{F} is a valid cummulative distribution function of a
continuous random variable. Then sketch the graph of \emph{F}.
hints:
A cumulative distribution function \emph{F} of a continuous random
variable must satisfy the following:

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  $\lim_{x\to -\infty} F(x) = 0$
\item
  $\lim_{x\to +\infty} F(x) = 1$
\item
  \emph{F} is continuous
\item
  \emph{F} is non-decreasing
\end{itemize}
